It’s exactly what I wanted to wear this winter.

product_title: Sol de Janeiro Hair & Body Fragrance Mist Travel Size 90mL/3.0 fl oz.
Review Comment: This smells amazing. I compared it with stripper scent that scent everyone is talking about. Honestly my opinion this smells better. I love the smell. The scent lasted all day. I am sold on this product. The price is great too. I will be buying more.

product_title: Sol de Janeiro Hair & Body Fragrance Mist Travel Size 90mL/3.0 fl oz.
Review Comment: When I tell you I thought I'd lost my mind spending darn near $25 on a body and hair mist let me tell you I thought I lost my mind but I heard nothing but amazing things about this so I went ahead and took a chance thank God I did because this is so decadent and sexy and grown and tasty and yummy it'll have you smelling like a snack is what I'm trying to say and if you do a whole grandmand body routine you better be single is all I'm saying because your man ain't going to want you to walk out the door I pair this with Sabrina Carpenter sweet tooth and I layer this on with my Eos cashmere vanilla as well as some Vaseline cocoa oil to gel girlfriend I smell like a dream this is my combo this is what I was looking for this will be my signature scent for the late fall early winter bring it bring it home I will be buying the bigger one and I will be getting a monthly subscription until they don't make this no more then we will fight I will fight whoever stops making this

product_title: Sol de Janeiro Hair & Body Fragrance Mist Travel Size 90mL/3.0 fl oz.
Review Comment: Was introduced to this line by my friend, who let me smell test them and got some for my birthday!!  Thought I loved number 40 the most out of the 68 and 62 I tried, but then I smell tested one of my friend’s new ones, 87 or rio radiance.  Omg!!  It is pretty much my favorite out of all of them, besides number 40.  It reminds me of an expensive perfume I tested out at Disney world when I was a kid (preteen/teenager?) that I loved so much!!!  I can’t remember if it was bvlgari or something else, but I just love it for the nostalgia and the refreshing floral sweet scent.  My least favorite is 62 only because I’m really not a fan of caramel/vanilla bakery type scents.  But if I had to use bakery type scents, I’d say 62 is the best so far to me out of those kinds.  But I happen to love number 40 even though there’s musk and vanilla present, but the black plum makes it smell so good and mature that I don’t care about the vanilla and musk being there, somehow it works.  But favorite is 87!!

product_title: Grace & Stella Under Eye Patches, Christmas Gifts for Women (12 Pairs) Christmas Gifts for Mom, Eye Patches for Puffy Eyes an
Review Title: Really like these for the price point!
Review Comment:
I really like these Grace & Stella under-eye masks! I’ve tried so many different eye patches, but these hold up to the scrutiny of some of the top brands. The cooling gel feels so soothing, especially in the mornings when my eyes are a bit puffy or I haven’t had enough sleep. After about 15–20 minutes, my under-eye area feels refreshed, and the dark circles look noticeably lighter.

The packaging is great too—24 pairs are perfect for keeping up a routine without running out too quickly. The gold look gives a little luxury feel and my daughter often likes using these with me for an extra special “spa” night.  I would say that these don’t work as effectively as compared to the Thomas Roth under eye masks that I have, however and most importantly, for this price point they are effective, affordable, and a great way to perk up your eyes!

product_title: Grace & Stella Under Eye Patches, Christmas Gifts for Women (12 Pairs) Christmas Gifts for Mom, Eye Patches for Puffy Eyes an
Review Title: Brightening, Refreshing, and Perfect for Self-Care
Review Comment: After using these grace & stella under-eye masks for 3-4 months, they’ve become a regular part of my skincare routine. The gold patches are not only refreshing but have noticeably reduced the appearance of dark circles. Each pair feels luxurious and stays in place, making them perfect for a quick self-care boost. They’re soothing, hydrating, and ideal for tired eyes, providing a brightened, well-rested look with consistent use.

product_title: Grace & Stella Under Eye Patches, Christmas Gifts for Women (12 Pairs) Christmas Gifts for Mom, Eye Patches for Puffy Eyes an
Review Title: Great results, but a pain to use!
Review Comment:
Let me start by saying that the product does work - I'm in my thirties and have been using them in the morning to help reduce puffiness and I've been very happy with the final result. I don't keep them in the fridge but they still give off a cooling feel. When I catch a glimpse of myself throughout the day, my puffy undereye area isn't what I notice first anymore which is a huge win. BUT, they are so frustrating to deal with!

First, it doesn't matter what I do when I open the package, one or both of the pads stick to the inside of the plastic pouch instead of sliding out on the little tray they sit in. You're supposed to put the flat side on your skin, and that's the side that gets stuck to the plastic, which makes me feel like product is being lost.

Also, as other reviewers have noted, they slide down! They don't fall off - they slide just enough to move off of the targeted undereye area, but not enough that you can tell just based off of how they feel sitting on your face. I have to keep checking the mirror and readjusting them constantly which is very inconvenient during a busy morning.

I actually want to give them 2 stars because they're so annoying to use, but that doesn't seem fair since the results are so good. If using them wasn't such a chore, I'd happily give 5 stars.

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Title: love this -- and I'm a makeup minimalist
Review Comment:
TLDR: It's advertised as a buildable coverage foundation, so with lighthanded application, it suits my minimalist makeup style. It goes on easily and with a little time to react with my skin, it looks like natural, healthy skin -- not makeup. Trial and error with the shade matching is inevitable. Plus it's summer and if you're spending time outdoors (like me), different shades may match at different times

I've never liked makeup -- probably bc as a teenager I watched my mother do her makeup for hours every morning and swore I'd never get up early to waste that much time making myself up for anyone. Fast forward 30 years -- while I would still go completely makeup-less if I could, dark spots/age spots/acne scars have forced me to consider a light approach to makeup. Plus I've been convinced that sunscreen is a must to fend off any further aging, so my late 40s makeup journey started with the search for the perfect tinted mineral sunscreen.

For people who say this is too heavy or cakey, I disagree. You can use a very light touch with this, you just need to not squish the puff down hard into the compact's cushion. I'm able to dab very lightly into the cushion, and if I get too much, I pat it off on the inside of the black flap that covers the cushion. If it looks wet on my skin, I know I've put too much on. I'm able to achieve enough coverage to even out redness and cover spots/blemishes without looking or feeling like I'm wearing heavy makeup. Since I'm oily/combination, I'll powder lightly (with either Morphe Soft Focus translucent setting powder or Hourglass Vanish pressed powder in translucent tan). If it looks too matte after the powder or if it's a really hot day, I'll spray TirTir's Mask Fit Makeup Cool Fixer (the cooling effect is so nice -- I wish Amazon sold this). Immediately after application, I think the cushion foundation looks a little "flat" (even with highlighter and contour/bronzer), but with time, it must react with my skin and it starts to look like glowy, healthy skin.

For people who are taking stars off bc of color matching -- you're buying makeup online -- no monitor or phone screen is going to accurately display a makeup color. So unless you're able to try this in person, it's going to be trial and error ordering online. I've gone through 6 shades (and 2 sample packs); aside from the 1st 2 shades not matching me, the others have been because it's summer and I'm getting darker as I spend more time outside. I have medium to tan skin with warm undertones -- this is the order of the shades I've tried and when I tried them:

27N Camel (mid-May): too yellow/olive for me. Also seemed to oxidize orange-ish on me

25N Mocha (late May): less yellow/olive than 27N Camel, but also too light on me

9-shade original sample pack (early June): sampled 24N Latte and 29N Natural Beige from the packets next to 25N Mocha from the compact. Both 24N and 29N seemed like potential matches. 25N was still too light. Instead of smearing on wet, I tried to press the sample makeup into my skin to mimic if I was using the puff and cushion compact; I'm convinced that the samples are okay to test colors, but don't represent the colors exactly as they come out of the cushion compact

27C Cool Beige (early June): TirTir released new shades so I wanted to see how this compared to 27N. 27C isn't really "cool"; it’s more peach-y and not as yellow/olive as 27N. It was a good match when I tried it. But this shade felt more drying than the previous cushions. I was coming off a week of antibiotics so maybe the meds dried me out, or maybe the newer shades are a different formulation?

24N Latte/29N Natural Beige (2nd week of June): got the compacts of these. Both were decent matches but I could see that 24N would be too light as the summer went on; 24N still seemed darker on me than 25N Mocha. 29N became my go-to shade for the next few weeks

6-shade medium sample pack (late June): ordered this to try the darkest shades in the pack, 30N Rich Honey and 31N French Beige. 31N was too dark for me and 30N was just a hair darker than my skin at that time

30N Rich Honey (mid-July): ordered 30N during the Prime day sale and it's been my go-to shade since then (it's now early August)

I totally expect that as we go into fall, I'll revisit the lighter shades as my summer tan fades. 

I was initially drawn to these red cushion foundations because they were supposedly SPF 40 when there were only 3 shades, and unlike most tinted sunscreens, I wouldn't have to get it all over my hands to apply. However, the US packaging doesn't mention SPF, so I prep as if these have no SPF. I prep with TirTir's Milk Skin Toner Light (I chose the Light for my oily/combination skin -- love what this has done for my skin). Then a vitamin C serum (not TirTir), Baebody eye gel, then Baebody eye cream. Next, If I'm not going outdoors at all, I'll use Drmtlgy's Water Creme moisturizer, then apply the cushion foundation. If I'll be outside for only a short amount of time, I'll use LiveTinted Huegard 3-in-1 SPF 30, then the cushion foundation. If I'll be outdoors for an extended amount of time, I'll apply the cushion foundation after the Water Creme moisturizer and TirTir's Mask Fit (Blue) Cool Sun Cushion SPF 50+ -- I wish Amazon sold this. It's one shade and does start off too light on me, but I can pat it in and it leaves just a minimal lighter cast on me. I love that it's sun protection that I can apply with a puff and not my bare hands. I've never had any issues with the red cushion foundation pilling over any of these different products.

With trial and error for shade matching and to get your desired amount of coverage, this TirTir red cushion foundation is an amazing product. 100% recommend the sample packs (if they're available) or the mini compacts to test shades, and also recommend TirTir's Milk Skin Toner Light, Mask Fit Makeup Cool Fixer, and Mask Fit Cool Sun Cushion (Amazon please please please start carrying these 2 Cool items!)

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Title: It Is Absolutely WONDERFUL To FINALLY Find Foundation That Matches My Skin!!! BUT....
Review Comment:
I absolutely LOVE this foundation!! You have no idea how wonderful it is to FINALLY find an affordable foundation that matches my skin tone PERFECTLY. As a "woman of a certain age" (let's leave it at that!) my only choices when I first started wearing makeup were the only department store foundation made exclusively for Black women (before there was ever Fenty) or settle for weird looking drugstore foundation matches. And who would have thunk it would be a South Korean makeup company that would finally match my skin tone all these years later!

I purchased shade 40N and 43N (at the time the two darkest TIR TIR shades). I got 43N because it was what a You Tube influencer that I follow used (MissDarcei) who is my exact shade in both summer and winter. When I heard that the foundation oxidizes a shade darker, I went with 40N first. As it turns out, 40N will work great for my winter shade.

There are tutorials on You Tube on how to best apply this foundation to get the best results. Robert Welsh is a great place to start.

As far as wear goes, I have done makeup tests with the foundation on my face bare skin and without primer and with skin care prep, and it looked as good as it did when I put it on. I wore this foundation for up to 12 - 15 hours each time, and the only thing that happened was that I did start looking a little "dewy" in my T-zone around hour 10, but nothing that a quick dab of powder wouldn't fix. The foundation never separated, never looked cakey, and didn't fill in any lines. It also played nicely with my concealer, etc.

1. It didn't separate even after almost 15 hours, which was the day I wore it just on my face and with nothing else on underneath it.

2. It didn't settle into my laugh lines or any fine lines.

3. There was very minimal transfer, and what transferred were things like blush and highlight. The foundation itself had practically no transfer.

4. The longer it was on my face, the better it looked, and it looked fantastic to start. Plus my skin looked great when I removed it.

5. It stayed on my face until I took it off, and this was even through gardening, running errands, and going out into a heat wave.

IMPORTANT TIPS TO REMEMBER:

1. DON'T keep constantly keep pressing into the foundation. When they say a little goes a long way, they mean it. Press the applicator LIGHTLY once into the cushion so that you can barely see the foundation on the applicator. If you can see it, tap the excess off on the inside of the cover. It is buildable, so start with a very light layer, which will be more than enough to do your whole face. You should be able to lightly press into the compact and use that little bit to cover your whole face, and if you miss a spot or two, pick up the excess that you wiped on the inside cover and use that.

2. If the foundation looks cakey or orange, you applied WAY too much to the pad and piled the excess right onto your face. The more you apply in the very first application, the more it will oxidize and give you cake-face.

3. DON'T drag the applicator sponge across your face. That's another reason why you have cake face and look like an Oompa-Loompa. TAP the sponge into your face, starting from the center and work outward.

4. DO NOT use a foundation brush or beauty blender to apply this foundation. This will also give you cake-face because you're using too much foundation all at once.

4. SKIN PREP IS KEY! I have combo/oily skin, so I did my skin prep (clean skin, moisturizer, primer for oily skin), let it sit and soak in for 5-10 minutes, and then applied this foundation. If you have oily skin, set this foundation with powder.

5. Wait for the foundation to set before you apply anything on top of it. It dries down fast, especially if you apply it the right way.

6. Go a shade lighter than you think you'll need. Even with the light application, it does oxidize like any other makeup does. It will oxidize a shade darker. And again, if you put on too much, you will turn orange.

I had no breakouts or flaky skin anywhere with this foundation. I think the people having problems with this foundation should address it through their skin prep. Of course there are people who will be allergic and who can't use the foundation, but I think the majority of people complaining about how the foundation looks don't know how to apply it correctly.

TL:DR - Absolutely love this foundation; 10 out of 10 would recommend.

UPDATE AND EDIT ON 8/27/2024:

TL:DR - I still like this foundation, but I got one of the recent shade updates (45W Chestnut), and it was a swing and a miss. I got a bit darker than anticipated because - SUMMER- and was really excited that a warm shade had come out. I pre-ordered it, got two compacts of the new shade b/c I remembered how quickly they sold out, and got one of the first batches.

Way, WAY too red. And when it oxidized, my face was two shades darker than my ears! Even after applying the foundation using the techniques I outlined earlier.

Do I still like the product? Yes. I like the coverage, I like the wear-ability, I like how it feels on my skin. But if you're still listening, Tir-Tir, please make warm AND cool shades, especially in the deeper skin tones. POC have different undertones, and not all dark people have red undertones.

I appreciate that you've been receptive to our requests thus far, but you're almost there with the shade range! Keep going, and like they say in K-Dramas, Fighting!

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Title: Love the product, the packaging is medium.
Review Comment: I love the product itself. It’s cute and compact. The coverage is FANTASTIC as someone who has bad skin sometimes and clear others. It blends so well, and it feel comfortable in the skin, not caked or heavy. No issues with oxidation. As someone who usually wears the palest color in American foundation, I did have to return and get a a few shades in to get my right match. And it lasts all day so far. However, I hate applying it with the little cushion thing. It doesn’t do well on getting around the nose or eyes, so I use a stippling foundation brush and it’s better. I think a beauty blender would work well too.

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Comment:
Pros: looks natural, easy application, makes your skin better, lasts all day and looks better as the day goes on

Decided to switch to Korean makeup after switching to Korean skincare and seeing a big improvement in my combo, acne prone, easily pigmented skin. I’ve been wearing this daily for 3 months, and I’ve only seen improvements in my skin. I have no plans to go back to any of the other foundations that I used previously (Lancôme teint idole, L’Oréal infallible, Dior forever skin glow, Maybelline super stay skin tint, Armani luminous silk) because this seems not at all pore-clogging, more natural looking, and stays well. This is also way easier to apply and makes doing my foundation really quick.

A little bit goes a long way—youtube videos explain that you need to pat the applicator back on the black plastic after picking up foundation off the cushion to take the excess off before applying. Doing this allows you to get good coverage from a thin layer without using too much. It’s buildable if you have an area that needs more coverage.

I do not use primer with this—I just let my BOJ sunscreen dry down, apply the foundation in a single thin layer, add another thin layer anywhere that needs more coverage, do the rest of my makeup, set with setting spray, and it sits really well all day, even through a workout.

I also find that it can be full coverage enough to conceal my under eyes with a few thin layers, but for a more glam look it works well with Tarte shape tape and Kosas concealer.

The only minor con is that I feel even the neutral shades skew warm, but it is nice that they have the trial packets, mini sizes, and a vast shade range.

I’ve also found that when I think I’m out of foundation, the sponge inside palette can be flipped over with tweezers and you’ll get a few more uses while you wait for your replacement to ship.

YMMV but I personally won’t ever feel the need to try another foundation for as long as this is available. I also never really write positive reviews but I’m really glad I ended up trying this product.

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Comment:
This foundation blew me away from 5am til 10p!! I'm a light complexion African American & I ordered 33w at first sent bck because it "looked" too dark. 2nd was 31n, (I've always been told I'm warm/gold undertone) so I def made sure I test my neck/chin. After a few min, it disappeared..couldnt even tell were i swatched it!! Never had a perfect match EVER! It wore all day! I touched up t zone after 7 hrs by blotting very lightly w/ powder..by 10p it was still perfect! It never moved, smudged nothing! Stayed pretty semi/natural matte. I didn't need any more touch ups period! It felt so light as if I had no makevup on. Got complimented that it looks like I have no make up on. Size perfect, will be upgrading to bigger size to keep travel with me. Blends like a dream! No smell. Quality A1! Kinda tricky finding ri match online by guessing but at least they accept returns. I'm telling you, if u find your ri match..you will love this product!! I don't even want to go bck to wht I was using lol its become back up! This application is easier to deal with vs liquid...

Update: I've been using the small one since I got it & I'm still happy with results. Ppl think I have no foundation on lol I needed to get the bigger size & a lighter shade for colder months.. all testers are sold out & I hope they get them bck in because it's a waste imo to have all their products sent bck due to wrong color. I'm sure some are using the sponge.( I didn't for this reason) I don't buy foundation online UNLESS I know exactly wht I need. But I need a tester sheet before I can move foward with any new shades & they are sold out..so i hope they are bringing in more. This is the most expensive foundation I've purchased IF I get the bigger size, but I wonder how much product there is because the 15$ doesn't seem like it's gona have longevity if you use it as an everyday..which makes no sense, when i use it lightly...so I will get the bigger size in the shade I know for sure that matches & see what happens...but

*WE NEED MORE TESTERS*

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Comment: This compact foundation is really good!  I am fair with blonde hair and blue eyes and typically wear the second to the lightest shade in almost any foundation.  In this one, I wear a 17N.  The shade range is phenomenal!  The foundation itself is very easy to apply, although I do not recommend using the included sponge.  It gives a much prettier finish if you use a brush or a Beauty Blender.  You also need to prep your skin before using, with a moisturizer and a primer if you use one.  The coverage is medium to full and it stays for hours.  The finish is matte.  I really love this product!  It is perfect if you are running out the door and want something that is fast and easy to apply.

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Title: Great coverage-little goes a long way, but not transfer proof
Review Comment: I love this foundation. I have a lot of scarring and hyperpigmentation but this covers it up in a few pats.The color match is perfect which is rare for me, a deeper skin tone with olive/neutral undertones. Very few foundations have a match. 40N is perfect for me. Only thing I dislike is that even though a little goes a long way, there isn't much product. I go through this at double the rate of a typical liquid foundation. Also, it's not transfer proof or water proof....you really need to set it, especially if you have oily skin. I wish they would make a powder for it. But if you have some translucent powder or a compact you like, that's really all you need. If they didn't make these extra promises you wouldn't be disappointed. If you are looking for a lightweight, easily full coverage foundation with great color match, this is the one! I like the compact design. I live in a hot climate so I can take this one anywhere and it doesn't get messed up. Please make a double compact with a powder included and then this would be perfect! I'll give it 5 stars anyway though because I really do like it and it has become my go to daily foundation. If they could figure out a way to make it SPF 50 too...that would be serious GOAT status for this one.

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Comment: I was not originally going to write a review for this product, however, my final experience with the foundation made me want to share. I had originally purchased 10C, I am usually the lightest shade available, and when I applied the cushion, 10C was incredibly light, even for me. This is certainly not a bad thing, I reasoned I just did not have a good eye for shade-matching. So I decided to try 15C instead, as this shade seemed reasonably darker than 10C. 15C was better, however, it looked very orange on my skin, see the picture I have included. I assumed that 13C would be the perfect shade, as it looked lighter than 15C on the website and it seemed to have cool-pink undertones, very similar to my skin. In actuality, 13C was much much worse than 15C, in fact, it looked even darker and more orange. All three of these shades are labeled as cool-toned on the website, however, 13C and 15C had very orangey undertones on my skin. Aside from the shade-matching issue, the formula was light-weight when it went on my skin. For those with warm undertones, I am sure this foundation would be very good.

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Comment: I purchased 2 shades of similar tone to try out(22N, 24N). Easy to use, medium coverage. The only reason I gave 4 stars was it does dry down a little darker than when first applied, which I was aware of. It does also dry very quickly on skin so keep that in mind when applying. Otherwise colors were true to description and leaves a smooth finish. Lasted several hours without issue.

product_title: TIRTIR Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation | Full coverage, Weighless, Skin fit, Satin Glow Finish, Korean cushion foundation (#2
Review Title: LOVE but 10c shade is WAY lighter than it looks!
Review Comment:
I've always joked that I'm almost albino because I have extremely fair skin. I wish I was born with red hair so it would make more sense to be so pale. 😅  It's almost impossible for me to find a shade match that doesn't oxidize too dark.

I love this formula, but both of their #13 shades were still a bit too dark. I was so excited to see a new #10 lighter shade, and the photos looked like it was going to be perfect for me... It was WAY too light, which was kind of shocking!

Hopefully they come out with some shades that are between 13 and 10 for us fair folks, because this is the best foundation I've ever tried. I'm very picky, and want something with good coverage that looks like skin and can hold up on my oily skin. This does it all for me!

I use a dampened pawpaw beauty blender sponge after applying with their included applicator - it gives the most natural skin look. Their little flat sponge doesn't bounce it into my skin the way I need it to, but I also don't want to waste product by dunking my beauty blender into the compact. 😉 Using theirs to apply and mine to blend works like a dream!

I have to set it with a powder for my oily skin, but I get such a smooth finish! Love love love!! It's much more transfer proof than the average foundation - definitely give it a try!

If you're oily like me, blotting sheets should always be with you in your purse. They will absorb excess oil halfway through the day, and your makeup will still look fresh and lovely for 12+ hours. So grateful I finally found a combination that works for me after all these years! My makeup used to start melting off within 4-6 hours and I thought there was no hope... 😅

13c is the lightest shade that works for me with a light/brightening powder right now, and I hope to see more light shade options in the future! ❤️

Wow... That was a lot, but I hope this helps someone who has skin similar to mine!

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Comment:
I’ve used two oil cleansers before this but was convinced to try this during prime day, after my friend’s recommendation (after her seeing it on TikTok). It’s relatively inexpensive so I thought it was a no-brainer!
I’m pretty pleased with it and will likely repurchase! Because my skin was used to oil cleansers beforehand, this didn’t break me out at all (but my friend claimed she had a purge phase before it calmed down). It lathers well, smells herbal, and only slightlyyy stings if it really gets into your eyes. I also love the pump, the trendy chubbier pumps don’t work nearly as well.
I use two full pumps and massage it into a full face of makeup (mascara included) before hopping in the shower and rinsing it off in there. I follow with cosrx’s good morning cleanser (highly highly recommend, have been using it for YEARS now). After the shower I go in with a BHA toner and first aid beauty ultra repair cream. And my skin has been happy :)

I’m not seeing a huge pore difference but my skin has been relatively break-out free, and really just non-agitated, which is what I strive for. I have oily, acne-prone skin that since has been cured with acutane, but I’ve committed to a no-frills skincare routine that has kept my face perfectly nice :)

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Comment:
This is a great oil cleanser for those with sensitive/super dry skin.  After decades of trying only soap-based products to wash my face and always having reactive pop-up zits, the counter clerk at Lancome recommended their Oil-in Gel Absolue cleanser. Life changing that soap is NOT necessary for cleaning!!

It was like magic for me... for 2 years until they discontinued the item.  This is a the best alternative I have found. Milk cleansers work better than soaps, but this is even better.  Excellent scent and "face feel" and rinses off VERY clean. No oily residue AT ALL.

We will see if it shrinks pores and reduces blackheads, but all I ask of a cleanser is it not make me break out and does not dry my skin out, and this one so far does that.

Also, the price is a small fraction of the Lancome product, a nice side effect. :) Good luck to my dry-faced friends!  :)

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Comment:
The cleaner does have a perfume smell but it's not offensive and hasn't irritated my skin.

No breakouts and some pore reduction. Helps with dryness. Using the double cleanse method really helps. You rub it on like you are washing your face without water and then get your hands wet and rub your face making it soapy, then wash off.

I follow up with toner and snail musin serum from the same company and a snail musin cream.

My skin is much softer and appears cleaner but I don't think it necessarily tones the skin. For that things like onion serums work best.

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Title: “Effective Makeup Remover with Gentle, Hydrating Formula”
Review Comment: This cleansing oil does an excellent job of removing makeup, dirt, and impurities without stripping the skin. It’s particularly great for those with sensitive skin, thanks to its gentle formula that includes Heartleaf extract, known for its calming properties. The oil melts away makeup and blackheads, leaving the skin feeling soft, clean, and hydrated. It doesn’t leave a greasy residue and rinses off well with water, which is a big plus. While it’s effective for deep cleaning, it’s still gentle enough for daily use without causing irritation. If you have oily or acne-prone skin, this oil might work wonders for balancing your complexion.

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Comment: I'd been interested in the idea of oil cleansing for ages and didn't commit until I read reviews about this one. I've really come to love using this (along with Anua's daily cleanser I also decided to try since my previous cleanser was almost gone anyway), and both the oil cleanser and their daily cleanser make washing my face actually more enjoyable. I've found a little bit of reduction of acne, including areas outside the face that get acne, like my chest. My ears (not inside the ear canal, the ear itself) generally develop a lot of grease and bumps, and the cleanser has improved those as well when nothing else I've tried (toners, soap, etc) seemed to make a difference. It also has proven to be very effective at removing makeup, and did it faster and easier than my micellar water did (and tasted less gross when removing lipstick lol). I think this cleanser has become a gateway to becoming addicted to other Korean skincare products and I definitely plan to keep it in my routine!

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Comment:
I was unsure if this would work for me. I’ve seen on TikTok (go figure) that this literally pulls out those little sebaceous filaments. Did I believe it? No… but of course I wanted to test it out. I was surprised when it actually worked though. For me, it works better with two pumps and massaging it into my face at least a minute. Does it pull out of every pore. No.. probably not. I’m still trying to perfect my skincare routine and I think this was definitely a good start. If you’re thinking about buying this, I would definitely give it a try and use it for at least a week or two before deciding if you love or hate it.

Side note: I have fairly sensitive skin and this doesn’t bother me at all :)

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Comment: So I started using this before my other face wash by the same brand over a month ago. I noticed I feel great in the shower until I get the my face washing step towards the end. I start feeling tired, irritable, light headed, dizzy, hard to breathe, etc. After listening to a podcast with a renowned toxicologist, I’ve learned how incredible harmful fragrance is to our skin and overall health. It’s an endocrine disruptor and a carcinogen. This is my only product I use with fragrance that isn’t essential oils. If this product made your skin worse, I’d say that’s why. Otherwise, I’d absolutely love it.

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Comment: Lo he usado en mi y en mi hijo adolescente por 3 semanas aproximado, tiene buen olor, te deja la piel suave, aunque es un aceite se retira solo con agua y no quedan residuos, en videos de personas que lo han usado decían que extrae los puntos negros, no es nuestro caso aún no he visto el primero que salga sin tener de apretar la cara, por todo lo demás es un buen producto.

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Title: This is a good oil cleanser!!
Review Comment: I know some reviews are iffy, however your skin type really matters when you use this. I have dry combination skin and I find this oil cleanser only irritated my skin the first three days I used it then it calmed down and worked really nicely for me.

product_title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil, Oil Cleanser for Face, Makeup Blackhead Remover, Korean Skin Care 6.76 fl oz(200ml
Review Title: Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil
Review Comment: The Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil is a game-changer for my skincare routine! It effectively removes makeup, dirt, and impurities without stripping my skin. The oil has a gentle formula that’s perfect for sensitive skin, and I love how it cleanses deep into my pores, leaving my face feeling fresh and hydrated. The heartleaf extract helps to calm my skin, and it’s been great for controlling blackheads. It doesn’t leave an oily residue, and my skin feels smooth and clean after each use. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for an effective, gentle cleanser!

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Comment: I’ve had this silk sleeping bonnet for about a week now and I absolutely love it! The silk material doesn’t feel cheap, instead, it feels very soft and left my hair feeling just as soft. I have wavy Caucasian hair and have used this every night while I sleep. I already had a silk pillow case, so I was skeptical about buying another silk product for my hair since I thought that the pillowcase was enough. I was proven wrong!! This sleeping bonnet works so much better than just a silk pillowcase to tame frizz, reduce breakage, and make my hair shiny and smooth when I wake up! I will say that the bonnet slips down over my eyes since there isn’t an elastic to keep it in place on my forehead, but when I’m asleep, this isn’t really an issue.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Title: Great product, but large for short hair
Review Comment: I love the feel and texture of this bonnet. I bought this as an upgrade from a super cheap bonnet I had bought a few months ago. Tie is plenty long and has a different texture that helps it stay on your head. This bonnet does slip slightly overnight, but this is NOT the products fault - I toss and turn and do not have long enough hair to adequately fill out the bonnet. It has not slipped off my head entirely and just moved back on my head. Would recommend this product.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Comment:
I am as white as milk but I have very long hair that is prone to frizz. I used to braid my hair at night but that made the frizz worse and was causing a permanent wave. So years ago I decided to try a bonnet. I fell in love with it, used it for years, but it became very loose and falling off overnight, defeating the purpose. So I bought this as a replacement.

First, the silk is very nice and it's not really just 'silk lined' making it heavier, it's all one piece. It has a very comfortable flat band on the edge. The ribbon is a cute touch.

Second, I had some issues. First problem - I am not cultural or fancy enough to fully understand how to tie the elegant bow like the model is showing. I am a very boring, very white girl. At first try, it flopped into my face. I tried adjusting it slightly, here and there, and eventually gave up and just tied it in the back to lay on my neck. I thought this would be an issue sleeping but it wasn't uncomfortable.

What I did have an issue with at first is that while the cap is very roomy for even the largest hair styles, or probably even curlers/rollers in shorter hair, the band was veryyy tight. Uncomfortably tight. I wasn't sure I would last the night and hesitated using it the following night. This may be because I was used to such a loose cap that it doubled as a sleep visor, but still important to note.

I've come to a compromise with it. I don't use it every night, but I will use it on wash days when I use leave in conditioner. The band loosened probably quicker than it should, but it's more tolerable now while still secure. It is also very silky while still breathable so my hair is always very nice the following morning. Then I usually swap out to a different one until the next wash day.

The other thing I want to mention is with my old bonnet and the more recent updated model of it I eventually bought as a replacement, I felt it was fashionable enough to be seen in public for a quick errand or a trip through the drive thru. I cannot do that with this bonnet. It may be because I can't master the elegant bow on top, but I also don't have enough hair to fill it out completely, so it's kind of floppy on my head. I'll wear it to bed, but I'm not wearing it in public. This may not be an issue if your hair type or style fills it out better than mine.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Comment: This material is very soft and the size is perfect for my long hair. I love the double lining and the thick headband style. It stays in place all night while offering great comfort.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Title: Makes my morning routine so easy!
Review Comment: This cap is so comfy and easy to use. I was worried about it slipping off since im not the most still sleeper, but I’ve learned how to tie it perfectly so it’s not too tight, but stays in place. The silk material makes my hair so shiny and almost eliminates my morning frizz 🩷🩷🩷

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Title: Nice silk but the bow is awkward to fasten
Review Comment:
Update: the company I purchased th A from offered to replace it with a different style which I found very polite and respectful of them. While regrettably it will be an additional errand to mail it back, it’s a kind offer and it gives me a lot of respect for this vendor. I wish to reiterate how nice it feels to wear a sleep bonnet made of real silk, and it’s unlikely I will ever return to wearing a synthetic sleep bonnet again in the future, now that I see what a nice difference the silk makes for the comfort of sleeping and care for both hair and skin. I’m 61 and while my body is aging as everyone does, who has the privilege of growing older, I still keep my long hair in nice condition, thanks to the nightly habit of wearing a sleep bonnet to protect my hair. I learned this trick from my best friend who happens to be black, and the hair protection that is afforded by regular use of a protective bonnet for sleeping has been of tremendous benefit to my hair, which is the typical White people hair of Eastern and Northern Europe, its thin, very very fine, oily scalp and dry split ends. I stopped washing hair with any shampoo that contains sodium laurel sulfate, I never use heat to dry or “style”, I use only henna, never any chemical dye for coloring and I wait a day or two between washings. Since learning how to take care of my hair, I have been able to grow it longer and healthier now than it was in my 30’s. Good nutrition is obviously important. But protecting the hair strands from breakage while sleeping has made a bigger difference than I ever imagined it would. THANK YOU, SILK SLEEP BONNETS!

I have this silk night bonnet hair protector in the standard configuration (adjustable elastic band) and I can see the structural reasoning behind placing these tie ribbon things the way they were placed. The bow can be cute. The style may be more traditional, harking back to when elastic wasn’t available. I just find this design a bit on the slippery slidey fall-off-your-head in the middle of the night. I love the real pure silk, not going to give that up, life’s too short for cheap materials next to my face. But the bow tie thing I won’t repeat, I’ll go for the adjustable band thing with elastic.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Comment: Keeps my curls looking beautiful. It fits amazingly and it's not to thick. It stretches enough to fit all my hair and keeps it soft.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Title: A great product for a great price
Review Comment: I was surprised by this. The packaging was intentional and I love the design. Because you can tie the band around your head you can adjust the tightness, which I like. It’s also very comfortable and seems to be protecting my hair, but I haven’t seen long term results yet because I just started using it.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Title: Best one I've tried so far. Great for everyone
Review Comment:
Best bonnet I've found so far. Stays on the most. I'm still trying to figure it out fully so it falls off some nights. But it's super stretchy and doesn't give me a headache like other ones have. Adjusting the tightness is easy if I do tie it too tight. If you're a active sleeper like my kiddo tho she will pull it off in her sleep. The more we have worn it and gotten used to it tho the less she's pulling it off.

I sleep so much better without my hair wrapping around my neck/face or getting stuck under my shoulder or pulled by my little. I haven't woken up with gross sweaty hair once since using it. If anything it keeps my head cooler. During the summer on super hot days it was a lifesaver even when not sleeping.

And this isn't even touching the fact that my hair is less frizzy and healthier since I've started to use the bonnet. The only problem I'm trying to figure out is that the front of my part gets messy. But I think that's because of how I sleep or maybe how I'm tieing it on. Definitely a learning curve! But worth it

If you have hair on your head you would benefit from this bonnet.

product_title: YANIBEST Satin Bonnet Silk Bonnet for Sleeping Double Layer Satin Lined Hair Bonnet with Tie Band for Women Curly Hair
Review Comment: I suppose sometime during my growing up years I associated using a scarf or silky hair cap at night was for those older women that went to the salon, got their hair teased and styled on Friday to preserve their style for church on Sunday..... So the first ad I saw of the Yanibest I dismissed out of hand - not for me. I have long hair and I don't like hair in my face while I'm sleeping. Usually a loose braid gets me through. Long story short, last night I used the cap for the first time and I'm very pleased with how it works. No more pulling on my own hair switching positions in bed and no more hair in my face. And it stayed on my head the entire night; I have issues with head bands and scarves staying on my head (possibly cone heads are in my ancestry). The cap is well made, with quality materials, and just enough stretch to make it easy to put on without being overly bulky at the back of your neck. Love this and foresee I will be purchasing again.

product_title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole, Fresh Scent, 7 Fl Oz
Review Title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo - Powerful, Effective, and Fresh Scented
Review Comment:
General Reviews Rating: 5/5

Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole is an outstanding solution for those dealing with dandruff and scalp issues. The active ingredient, ketoconazole, is proven to effectively treat dandruff by targeting the root cause—fungus on the scalp. After using it just a couple of times a week, I noticed a dramatic reduction in flakiness and itchiness, leaving my scalp feeling clean and refreshed.

The shampoo has a pleasant, fresh scent that isn't overpowering, and it lathers well, allowing for easy application. It leaves my hair feeling soft and manageable without drying it out, which is a plus for a medicated shampoo. The 7 fl oz bottle provides plenty of product, especially since it only needs to be used twice a week to see results.

For anyone struggling with persistent dandruff, Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo is highly effective and worth every penny. It's gentle, smells great, and works fast—highly recommended for long-term dandruff relief!

product_title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole, Fresh Scent, 7 Fl Oz
Review Comment:
This shampoo helped tremendously with my dandruff and flaking that NONE of the shampoos in my country (Georgia) could get rid of, not even the ones with 2% ketoconazole. For some reason this shampoo, with 1% of the same thing can actually help while they cannot.

If this shampoo helps with your dandruff and flaking, and you have similar symptoms in other places on your face/body (e.g. beard/moustache/eyebrows, chest, armpit) apply this on those spots too, it will help. Obviously make an effort to not get this in your eyes.

While the shampoo itself is great and has become essential, I'd like to state for potential buyers that this shampoo will leave your hair VERY dry, so be sure to use a conditioner or some other hair moisturizing product after it. I usually apply the shampoo, wait for about 5 minutes, wash the hair properly, then use the Nizoral conditioner. My hair ends up feeling amazing.

In summary: highly recommended, and not just for hair. My head has finally stopped being a snow machine

product_title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole, Fresh Scent, 7 Fl Oz
Review Title: gentle on scalp and leaves it feeling clean
Review Comment: Shampoo works really well! It reduces dandruff fast and helps with itching after just a few washes. It’s gentle on my scalp and leaves it feeling clean without drying it out. I’d definitely recommend it if you have dandruff. It arrived in the original box without leaking and the scent is not overpowering. I have used prescription strength shampoo and this works just as well.

product_title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole, Fresh Scent, 7 Fl Oz
Review Title: Effective and Refreshing - Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole
Review Comment:
The **Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo** has been a game-changer for me! With 1% Ketoconazole, it effectively tackles dandruff and helps keep my scalp healthy and flake-free. After just a few washes, I noticed a significant reduction in itching and flakiness, and it has continued to work great.

The shampoo has a fresh, pleasant scent that makes my hair smell clean without being overpowering. I also appreciate that it lathers well and rinses out easily, leaving my hair feeling soft and manageable. It’s a bit pricier than regular shampoos, but it's worth it for the results. Highly recommend for anyone dealing with dandruff!

product_title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole, Fresh Scent, 7 Fl Oz
Review Title: Attention Suffers of Mild Seborrheic Dermatitis and/or Psoriasis!!
Review Comment:
Alright, let preface this by saying, I am not a doctor or medical expert, I can only speak to the results, I myself have experienced.

Back Story:

So about 2 years ago, I started getting dry skin around my mouth, nose, eyebrows, and occasionally my ears and cheeks. It was pretty mild, so I never went to a dermatologist. However, before this time, never did I have to lotion my skin regularly, so this was a change for me.

When this started happening, I used Aquaphor Healing Ointment (Advanced Therapy), and while it made me look greasy or like I was sweating for a couple hours, lol, it wore off enough, and would leave me looking normal the rest of the day. The only time my skin was really irritated was right after I would shave. However, dryness/peeling would get real bad if I did not at least lotion all those areas of my face after I showered. While I did some minor Googling about the issue, I was clearly too lazy to do anything about it, and the lotion solution sufficed for me. Dumb, I know.

Anyways, fast forward to about 1.5 months ago. I started to notice a white growth under my left thumbnail that started to detach my nail from my nail bed. For some reason, this concerned me more than the dry skin on my face. So after Googling again, I found ti could be a problem with yeast growth under my nail. Then, I remembered reading that yeast growth could be causing my face problems. After connecting the dots, I decided to find a possible solution, to possibly kill two birds with one stone.

After some searching, I stumbled onto Nizoral. After reading all the reviews, I was encouraged. I purchased this product and it has helped me tremendously. I could not be happier. It says to use it only every 3-4 days, which I say you should stick to, because I would use it on back to back days and it would seem to dry my skin out, but that could have been in my head.

My Use:

So, I know this is shampoo, but I almost treat it like liquid soap. I rub it on my skin/scalp and leave it there for 3-5 minutes. For my fingernail, I would lift it, since there was a gap and the nail was coming up. I put Nizarol directly in the ever so small opening between the nail and nail bed, and left it for 3-5 minutes. I am not sure if that was smart for the fingernail, but it worked for me.

Results:

TLDR: It worked everywhere, lol.

Mouth/Upper Lip: This area was the worst of my dry skin issues. Like said, it was especially bad after shaving. Sometimes, my skin would be patchy red and inflamed after shaving, especially on the top of my chin and right below my lip. It would look gross for like an hour. In addition, when I did not shave, but did not lotion my skin, this area would eventually get pretty flaky before the end of the day. I also had issues with the corners of my mouth, especially after eating. My upper lip generally did not have any issues, but sometimes I would in very cold/dry weather.

So, after using this product, I have seen a great deal of improvement. For the first time in almost 2 years, I do not have to lotion my face every single day. The patch below my lip still is not where I want it to be, but it is very much better. My skin feels dry after a shave, but now it does not look red or inflamed. It is getting better, and I think it will continue to get better. The corners of my mouth have issues if I do not lotion for 2 days or so, but they are much more minor to what they used to be. The minor issue above my lip is currently non-existent, however, we have not had any cold weather yet. This was the most noticeable problem I had with my dry/flaky/peeling skin, and I am happy to say, Nizarol has worked wonders. I now can use regular lotion instead of Aquaphor, which I still adore.

Eyebrows: This was my second worse area, and I say eyebrows, but it was actually the area in between my eyebrows would flake worse than my eyebrows. I rub Nizarol into my eyebrows, in between them, and around my eye sockets. Nizarol has pretty much cleared up this issue, and I am thrilled Nizarol has basically eliminated the second worst dry area on my face. If I do not use lotion for several days, it does flake, but in a very minor way. Side note: be careful around your eyes, it burns pretty good if you get the shampoo runoff in your eye, lol.

Nose/Nostrils: This was my third worst area. I would have dry skin on the sides of my nose, the point of my nose, and even on the inside of my nostrils! First off, putting Nizarol in your nostrils may not be safe. If you do do it, don't huff the Nizarol when it is in your nostrils, breath through your mouth. My nose area has improved, but is now more of an issue than my eyebrows. Still it is much better, and I can go a couple days without using lotion. It is also more of the inside of the nostrils than the outside of my nose. I think if I were willing to put Nizarol further up my nose than just the inside rim, I could eliminate the problem. But, at what cost? Lol. I don't want to ingest this stuff, lol. Either way, I am still happy!

Head/Scalp: I have never had much of an issue with my scalp other than minor dandruff, for which I have always used Head & Shoulders. Despite this, I use this shampoo, as intended. I can not honestly tell if it is making any difference. Also, I have very short hair, so I cannot tell if this makes my hair coarse like everyone else says. If it does, I would use a conditioner like other reviews suggest.

Ears/Earlobes:  So, while it was more rare, but sometimes, my ear lobes and the bottom crease where the ear connected to my face would get dry and flake. I rub Nizarol on my ears, on the inside of my ears, and behind my ears/ear lobes. I have zero issues here now and never have to lotion this area any more.

Forehead/Cheek Areas:These were not really problem areas unless it was cold/dry/windy. We have not had that type of weather, but I really do not think it will be a problem.

Pelvic Area: I know this is a touchy subject, lol, but  what I have to say is tame and could help some people. So several months back, something new happened, I noticed my pelvic area was dry as well, after using clippers. I used Nizarol in the creases of my leg, and in in my pelvic area, including directly on my -----. Results? Well, this has virtually eliminated the dry skin everywhere. Even better, I am chaffing less when running, which is awesome! I figured Nizarol was working everywhere else, so what the hell? Luckily for me, this was another minor issue it helped.

Fingernail: Getting back to my fingernail, I had this white chalky/flaky formation under my fingernail. It had got to almost halfway down my thumbnail. It was causing my nail to lift. It did not hurt, but I thought it was unsightly. So I lifted the nail and put Nizarol in there. Again, possibly not safe, but a couple weeks in and my nail is almost back to normal. I eventually started cutting deeper into my nail to get the Nizarol farther back, which has worked. My nail almost looks normal and it looks like it is pushing the last of white to the font of my nail. So the growth stopped moving backward and it has improved. Another win!

Others Uses?: As you can tell, I pretty much use this stuff all over. I put it on my elbows, the knuckles of my toes, and the point of my ankle bone. I think it is helping, but I am not 100% sure. What I can tell you is that it seems that it seems easier to get the dry skin off after applying the shampoo. A pedicure is on the docket and if I remember, I will update this review.

Conclusion:

Nizarol has worked way better than I could have hoped, and I did not even have to go to the dermatologist. I am hoping within a couple months, my skin will go back to normal. I am not sure if that will happen, but I love what Nizarol has done for me. I encourage anyone that has some of the issues I had to give it a try. Again, my issues were mild compared to some of the pictures I have seen, but I imagine if you are struggling with mild to intermediate issues, and you have not gone to a dermatologist, this could help you.
I hope all this helps! Good luck!

****Update: 7/25/2017***

Fingernails: Nizoral completely fixed my nail problem!

Face: So, when I first started using this product, I saw quite a bit of improvement. I no longer have red patches anywhere on my face. The only issue is that there have been diminishing returns. Nizarol has helped tremendously, but I still have dryness and dead skin issues. It is much more mild now, but still exists, however, I am grateful for the continued results.

Scalp: Lol, I still cannot tell if this is helping or not. I still have minor dandruff. Nizarol has had no effect on my scalp as far as I can tell. Not a big deal for me though...

product_title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole, Fresh Scent, 7 Fl Oz
Review Comment:
* Disclaimer, this is a long review, but I'm so incredibly happy with the results that I want you to know how upsetting it was that nothing worked longer than a day until I bought this shampoo.

I started getting dandruff in my late 20's. I'm 36 now. At first it wasn't bad and then it got noticeable to the point I was embarrassed. For reference I have really dark brown hair, thick and very long. I had literally tried every kind of dandruff shampoo and conditioner from stores to online to salon recommended. From $5 bottles to $35 plus. The only way they would remotely work is if I used them daily, but by the end of the day or next morning, I'd have the ugly white flaking or white piece stuck in the middle of a strand of hair. If I went two days without using them, it would be enough to notice even with my hair in a bun And headband. And I usually wash my hair every 3-4 days because I never needed to wash it daily.
I randomly searched on Amazon again about a month or two ago for dandruff shampoo because now it was getting itchy and I was so upset every day to see my hair. I found this product with high reviews, Nizoral. I said to myself, I'm desperate and I'll try anything. I purchased it. When I first went to use it, it was super blue and I wasn't sure how it would leave my hair, but I scrubbed it all around my scalp, only one wash. Then I used my normal conditioner, Nexxus, not any kind of anti dandruff conditioner (because I have those too). I wanted to see what the Nizoral would do without also having to use an anti dandruff conditioner. And for another reference (there's a lot of these), I first used it after not washing my hair for about 3-4 days, with only using dry shampoo in between. I got out of the shower and didn't see white flakes. I let my hair dry naturally as I wasn't going anywhere and drying it is a 30-40 minute process which I don't like doing lol. But I love my long hair; it's a love/hate relationship.
Anyways, back to this magical shampoo, I woke up the next morning and no flakes, no white stuck in strands of my hair, no grossness falling out of my hair onto my sink or clothing when I ran my hands through my hair or brushed it, nothing! I was so excited, but hesitant because I said let's give this the day test. Checked back at night, nothing. Checked the next morning, nothing. I went 4 days without one single flake before my head was a little itchy because of just needing to be washed.
I repeated the Nizoral shampoo with my normal conditioner again, and same thing. Days and no flakes or itching. I literally cried I was so happy and couldn't believe the type of sorcery this product had bestowed upon my head.
I am now on month 2 or 3 I think, and I use this once a week with my regular conditioner and the dandruff is just gone. And that is days in between without washing my hair. It also doesn't make my hair dry or feel gunky or anything. My hair is always soft and smells nice. I was worried something like this would give off a weird medicated kind of smell, but not at all!
If you have dandruff and nothing has worked or your tired of having to use something every day in order for it to work, just stop and buy this. It's not even that expensive and I have had two months of use from ONE bottle; again with that reference, I have hair down to my bum that takes 40 fricken minutes to dry with a blow dryer because it's so thick.
Hands down I would literally promote this shampoo anywhere, even though my dandruff has been a really embarrassing condition for me. I wish I had before and after photos, but my dandruff was pretty much gone after the first use. So I couldn't even get a before picture now and it hasn't come back.
Seriously, if you made it this far, Just buy it!

** Also, quick footnote, I do shower daily. I just don't wash my hair every day. It goes up in a tight bun on my hair days off in the shower, which usually will stay up the rest of the day because I work from home and between being a single Mom getting a 7 year old up and ready for school and morning chores and then working for 10-12 hours, I'm too lazy to style my hair. Now, I do use a  normal dry shampoo in between hair washes. But I had that routine before I bought this product, so I know 100% the only reason my dandruff is gone is because of the Nizoral shampoo.

*** Second footnote, I'm not being paid to write this nor was this some kind of promotional item I got to use to write about. I'm just that impressed and so happy with the results and I know there has to be someone else out there that is going through that struggle I did and I just want that person to feel the happiness I do right now.

**** This is the longest review I've ever written in my life.

product_title: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo with 1% Ketoconazole, Fresh Scent, 7 Fl Oz
Review Title: If you have dandruff, buy this now!
Review Comment: I have had bad dandruff since I was a kid.  I have tried every anti dandruff shampoo and have had to settle with Head and Shoulders.  I had pretty much given up and have had to just deal with it.  And I wear a lot of black, so it's embarrassing.  I saw a reel about Nizoral and that dandruff is not always dry skin, which I had always assumed.  I decided to try it and after the second wash, my dandruff is gone.  And I do mean gone.  I also bought the shampoo brush by the same company and I think the trick is to lather it up and then let it sit for 5 minutes before rinsing.  I also wash my face and beard with it.  I couldn't be happier.  I will use this forever, so long as it's available.  I use regular shampoo daily and Nizoral every third or fourth wash.

product_title: Amazon Basics Hypoallergenic 100% Cotton Rounds, 100 Count
Review Comment:
The Amazon Basics Hypoallergenic 100% Cotton Rounds are a staple in my skincare routine. These cotton rounds are soft, durable, and don’t fall apart like some other brands I’ve tried. Whether I’m applying toner, removing makeup, or using them for nail polish removal, they get the job done perfectly without any lint or fraying.

I love that they’re hypoallergenic and made from 100% cotton, so I feel confident using them on my sensitive skin. They’re also the perfect thickness—not too thin, but not bulky—and they absorb just the right amount of product without wasting it.

The 100-count pack is great value for the price, and it lasts me a good amount of time even with daily use. If you’re looking for reliable cotton rounds that don’t break the bank, these are a fantastic choice. I’ll definitely keep these on hand!

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment: Has a white color and doesn't lather. It's like most acne treatments. A little goes a long way. Id recommend using it once a week until your skin gets used to the product as it's pretty string. Ensure to moisturize as it does dry the skin out. Quite durable, lasted 3 months surprisingly. Made my skin clear up in a few days. Ingredients are powerful! Definitely  a 10/10

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment: Where was this when I was a teenager? This is my holy Grail. It's worth every cent. Use it EXACTLY as the instructions state. Also can be used as a spot treatment. I can put it on overnight on a spot that may be flaring and it's gone the next day. No soreness.

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment:
I saw videos recoomending this cleanser for a while, but my skin wasn't problamatic so I decided to go on with my usual ruitine. Lately, I started to break out and get more blackheads so I got this cleanser and WOW.

 While it is quite intense, and tends to dry out your skin, it's not anything a good moisturizer can't fix. I use this with Paula's Choise exfoliator and my skin looks so much better. My blackheads come out really easy, many have dissapeared, especially on my nose and my pimples go away really soon, when I do get a few.

For the people who's skin isn't used to active ingredients though - work this into your routine slowly, cause it is intense.

P.s. Use white towels cause no metter how well you wash it off, it will still bleach

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment: It works very well- but too well. If i apply it by massaging for 60 seconds on my face as recommended on the product packaging it does take care of my acne, but it also burns my skin, leaving it red and irritated. So what I do is apply it in the shower a few times a week and quickly lather (under 30 seconds) and THOROUGHLY wash the product off to avoid this. I’ve even found if I don’t pay particular attention to washing off my earlobes, it goes inside my piercing areas and causes irritation there.

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment: I used one bottle before now on my second. Im dark skin, it removes pimples and i don't get new ones unless i forget to use it for a few days. It also doesnt lighten my completion

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment: I'm the type of person that will read through 1 million reviews on products, and I took a shot with this one. At first, I was skeptical if it was even working but as I've been using it it is definitely working. I haven't broken out much(although alarmingly, on the day I haven't used it I've broken out), and it seemed that it has cleared up , so it works. I'd say it's not very gentle, as it will leave your skin feeling dry, but if you pair it with a moisturizer you should be fine. Smells very chemically, sometimes will irritate your eyes. But. the bottle is big, I think this will last me 2 months or so, and that's with my dumb brother stepping on it😔.

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Title: Works great- non stripping. Can also be used for pits privates and feet.
Review Comment: This works great on face, pits privates and feet. This does need to be left on for a few minutes before washing off to kill and bacteria lurking. Does not dry my face out. I use a Paula’s choice maiturizibg face wash after leaving this on for a few minutes for it to work. This helps with decreasing bacteria on other body parts- same thing, leave this on for a few minutes and be careful not to put too close to sensitive private areas.

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment: I always had really clear skin but I moved to a tropical place with humidity and starting experiencing oily skin and breakouts. This worked great (I will say you have to be very consistent and be patient it takes a little bit of time to see results) BE WARNED IT WILL BLEACH EVERYTHING (clothes, towels, etc). The amount of shirts I’ve ruined before I realized it was this is ridiculous…it does kind of concern me what it’s doing to my skin if it can bleach so easily

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment:
I have scoured the earth for an effective face wash for my skin. Tried almost all of the trending face washes on instagram and TikTok such as cerave, laroche-posay, cetaphil, vanicream, and so much more. I discovered this product 3 years ago and have used it religiously since. It makes my combination skin so smooth, and prevents breakouts. It is PERFECT if you pair it with an oil cleanser, as it is a little thick and has a hard time cleaning out the sebaceous filaments in your pores (I recommend DHC cleansing oil). The product can also be a little drying! So make sure you pair it with good products that replenish your skin moisture barrier (hyaluronic acid, good moisturizer like Laroche-posay or pods). And finally, yes it does bleach things!!! I combat this with buying white towels, and rotating my bath towels between the same 3 so I don’t bleach all of them! Trust me, the bleaching thing is worth it for crystal clear skin! This product does irritate my husbands skin a little but, but he has SUPER sensitive skin. Like the kind of sensitive that we have to buy him special laundry detergent. So if your skin is THAT sensitive, I wouldn’t recommend this product. :)

(Please enjoy the photos highlighting my pimple free face :))

product_title: PanOxyl Acne Foaming Wash Benzoyl Peroxide 10% Maximum Strength Antimicrobial, 5.5 Oz
Review Comment: I have suffered from armpit BO all my life (I’m 28 now). I came across this cleanser years ago on a YouTube video from a dermatologist I follow and she recommended this, but when you’ve tried almost everything you don’t have any hopes so I didn’t try it. I had try vinegar, baking soda with lemon. Baking soda with lemon does work but application is messy. Vinegar also works but is not very long lasting. Tea tree oil its also good, but then again, not that practical. I have tried every deodorant, the more effective were clinical degree in conjunction with vinegar cause on its own it doesn’t last. My armpits sweat too much and that in combination with bacteria creates BO. A couple of years I saw a video that recommended african black soap. I tried and it really worked, that’s when I realized that baby soap that my dermatologist prescribed for my atopic dermatitis was not doing a very good cleaning bacteria on my armpits. I bought another african black soap, but the bars were just too big and it came a mess easily, and it was not as good as the previous brand I used before. It is also worth mentioned that my body gets used to every new deodorant real fast. I then tried perspirex, which I used the blue one which is the strongest (up to 5 days) but I can only go as far as 3 days and my armpits where smelling again. I came across a tik tok video which recommended Panoxyl again, I decided to give it a try and bought it on Amazon without any high hopes. I tried immediately and it was the miracle I was waiting for. I used the 10% concentration and my armpits do not smell AT ALL. I use it like this: everyday when I shower, I put the tiniest bit amount on every armpit (a little goes a long way and remember too much can dry your skin), it says to give it a massage but I usually just leave it for 1-2 min and then remove it. Then I put The Ordinary’s Glycolic Acid (This is a habit I created before trying Panoxyl and because I burned my skin using Perspirex 6 hrs after shaving, Glycolic Acid did help with hyperpigmentation and bad odor, but as the other remedies, it is not as long lasting) and I still use the same perspirex blue one that I first bought since I haven’t run out of it. I used perspirex after 5 days just because it says this is the longest you can go, but I didn’t have any BO, and the next day I still don’t smell anything. The only test that I haven’t done yet is under workouts as currently I can’t workout because I’m fasting, but before when I ended my workout my BO was really bad because of the sweating, but even if I haven’t tried it, I know it won’t disappoint as even when there’s an issue it will be fixed when you shower or you can do it just before the workout. I thank Panoxyl for this since I have fought BO since I was in my teen years, this gave me so much insecurity, I tried everything and still I didn’t smell good, which was really unfair and people always criticize. That’s why I’m leaving this review, maybe it can help somebody else. My sister had the same issue, a little more mild than me and now she is just as in love and recommended it to everyone we know that suffers from this. She uses The Ordinary’s Glycolic Acid and the Vichy red deodorant. On the face, I rarely have breakouts but this week I had two minor breakouts and this helped them cure really fast, asI guess it kills the bacteria. I only used it on the breakouts and not the rest of my face, as I’m scared it might dry out my skin and I have oily skin and live on tropical humid weather. If you are dry skin or live on colder or dryer place it might be best to watch out as the product could be drying or make your skin sensitive.

product_title: e.l.f. Monochromatic Multi Stick, Luxuriously Creamy & Blendable Color, For Eyes, Lips & Cheeks, Dazzling Peony, 0.17 Oz
Review Comment: I was super excited when I found this product and it came out amazing! I tried it as soon as it came in, the application is super smooth, it spreads well, and the color is gorgeous. product_title: e.l.f. Monochromatic Multi Stick, Luxuriously Creamy & Blendable Color, For Eyes, Lips & Cheeks, Dazzling Peony, 0.17 Oz
Review Comment:
I hate the color of my lips naturally, they are just so washed out.  I often want a nudish shade to just give a little bit of color and still look pretty natural, just look better.  And I absolutely abhor shiny, gel slicked, sticky products on my lips.  This has the very slightest shimmer, and is a great nude tone for me, without being absolutely nude.  I can only feel it on my lips for a brief time, so if you are expecting a waxy product that sits longer like a chapstick or other lip balm, this also won't fit your needs.

This is Sparkling Rose.  Also works as blush in a pinch, I just prefer how powdered blushes go on, as it's easy to overdo it with the way the sticks apply to the skin.  And yes, you don't get much product, but if you compare to how much product is in any lipstick or balm, it's about the same.  $5.00 is a great price.

product_title: e.l.f. Monochromatic Multi Stick, Luxuriously Creamy & Blendable Color, For Eyes, Lips & Cheeks, Dazzling Peony, 0.17 Oz

I actually prefer using this as a blush. I dot it on lightly at first, then determine whether or not I need more. I have a fair complexion and have found that it blends well with my skin tone and does not turn orange .I have also been using it on my lips. And even though I like the color, I have found it to be a little dry. I have found that applying some clear gloss or moisturizing lip treatment  first will take care of this. Overall , though, I'm pretty happy with this product.

product_title: e.l.f. Monochromatic Multi Stick, Luxuriously Creamy & Blendable Color, For Eyes, Lips & Cheeks, Dazzling Peony, 0.17 Oz

Blending well and generally happy with the quality at such a low price.  Not sure if I want to apply around my sensitive eyes though.

product_title: e.l.f. Monochromatic Multi Stick, Luxuriously Creamy & Blendable Color, For Eyes, Lips & Cheeks, Dazzling Peony, 0.17 Oz
